tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE production_tasks (
  task_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  task_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  deadline DATE,
  estimated_duration INTERVAL,
  assigned_worker VARCHAR(50),
  task_priority INT
);

CREATE TABLE production_tasks (
    task_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(255),
    task_description TEXT,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE production_schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_id INT,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    FOREIGN KEY (task_id) REFERENCES production_tasks(task_id)
);

CREATE TABLE production_tasks (
  task_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  task_name VARCHAR(255),
  start_time TIMESTAMP,
  end_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE production_schedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  task_id INT,
  schedule_date DATE,
  is_completed BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE optimal_schedule (
  optimal_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  schedule_id INT,
  task_id INT,
  optimization_score FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE ProductionTasks (
    task_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(50),
    machine_id INT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    end_time TIMESTAMP,
    status ENUM('Planned', 'In Progress', 'Completed')
);

CREATE TABLE ProductionSchedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_id INT,
    machine_id INT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    end_time TIMESTAMP,
    CONSTRAINT fk_task FOREIGN KEY (task_id) REFERENCES ProductionTasks(task_id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_machine FOREIGN KEY (machine_id) REFERENCES Machines(machine_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ProductivityMetrics (
    metric_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    machine_id INT,
    productivity_value FLOAT,
    recorded_at TIMESTAMP,
    CONSTRAINT fk_machine FOREIGN KEY (machine_id) REFERENCES Machines(machine_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ResourceAllocation (
    allocation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_id INT,
    resource_id INT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    end_time TIMESTAMP
);
